A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: At no time did i find myself find myself feeling excited about anything I was seeing during this film and only three times I found myself vaguely interested in what I was watching. It’s a dull movie\, contrived\, and ordinary which took no risks and pushed no boundaries. It was as interesting and exciting as a reading of an unabridged dictionary while drinking warm salt water. Luke and Rey? Okay\, that was somewhat interesting in a Remo Williams kind of way. Rey and Kylo? Sure\, I bought a little of that. Fin and what’s-her-name? Go get some popcorn because that whole thing\, how it’s constructed\, is boring and cliche. It could have been cut in half and had the same effect. The “chase” was as exciting and riveting as a drag race for dump trucks. The movie wasted a lot of opportunities for something special and they (Disney\, et al.) chose to shoot for the boring\, ordinary middle. It’s the story\, stupid. If the story is dull and the characters disinteresting\, you’ve got nothing that will be remembered in the long term. But\, hey\, I actually didn’t mind the porgs and the actors all did fine work in this sub-par action film. They did what they could with what they had.
